intro: Agoseris heterophylla var. glabra, commonly known as the smoothleaf agoseris, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are smooth and alternate, with a distinctive shape that varies along the stem. It produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer.
